questions.label: ICEBREAKER
prompts: What’s the best TV show/movie that you have seen recently?
UC Socially Dead; Agree or disagree?
What is your favorite holiday?
What is your favorite kind of music? Do you have a favorite singer/band?
What did you do this past summer?
Do you speak another language? If so, teach everyone how to say hello.
What has been your favorite class so far?
What do you like to do outside of school?
If you were to become a YouTuber, what would your topic be (e.g., vlogger, gamer, etc.)?
How is your course load this quarter?
How do you like to spend your weekends?
Do you have a favorite off-campus place in San Diego? What is it?
Do you have any pets? Are you a dog or cat person?
What is one thing on your bucket list?
What is your favorite place to spend time on the UCSD campus?

questions.label: IDEATION
prompts: What takes you out of your comfort zone?
What experiences have you had working with people who have backgrounds that differ from your own?
What steps can people take to make everyone feel included in a community?
Have you ever had to resolve a situation that involved issues related to diversity, equity or inclusion?
What do see as the strengths of a diverse academic environment?
What do see as the most challenging aspects of a diverse academic environment?
Have you ever had to handle a situation where someone was being treated unfairly? If so, what did you do?
What are the best strategies to use when communicating with people who are different from you?
Have you ever had an experience where at first you didn’t understand or agree with someone’s perspective/point of view but then eventually you did? How did you get from point A to point B?
How do you challenge stereotypes and promote sensitivity and inclusion?

questions.label: TEAM QUESTION
prompts: What do you believe is the most important factor for a successful team?
What do you hope to get out of this class?
Based on previous team projects, what do you think worked and didn’t work for you?
What do you look for in a good team member?
Ideally, how often would you like to meet with your team members?
How do you deal with conflicts in the team?
How do you decide to split the work among team members?
What is your main mode of communication for your project when you work on a team (e.g., email, messages, WeChat)?
Describe your leadership experience (e.g., student club or project leader)?
What is your biggest pet peeve in group projects?
What are your strengths and weaknesses in group projects?
What is the most important thing you personally need to do when you’re in a team?
How can you help create psychological safety in your team?
What helps you to feel psychologically safe in a team?
Have you ever had to work with someone who was non-responsive? What did you do?
